intro: Atuna racemosa subsp. excelsa, commonly known as the white atuna or white-flowered atuna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. The subspecies excelsa is distinguished by its more robust growth and larger flowers compared to other subspecies of Atuna racemosa.
